result.execSummary:
The defendant Shannon C Bailey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Substance Abuse Programs.
11/12/14 COURT GRANTS 195 DAYS SENTENCE CREDIT

superMiscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Submit to a mental health assessment and follow through with any treatment or counseling or assessments recommended by agent. Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent.

No Contact with the victim or any member of the victim's family in any way. Defendant to have no access to Facebook, or any health caring accounts website or any site of that nature. Defendant can not reside in the State of Wisconsin. Defendant must relocate outside of the State. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained, surcharge is imposed. Maintain full time employment and/or school. 
*AMENDED 6/29/2015:  COURT MODIFIES NOT TO RESIDE OR BE IN THE FOLLOWING COUNTIES FOR ANY REASON:  WAUkESHA, RACINE, MILWAUKEE, OZAUKEE, WASHINGTON, WALWORTH, DODGE OR JEFFERSON COUNTY.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: the 5/12/2014 exhibit #1 destroyed pursuant to statue.
Defendant appeared by video.

Defendant Shannon C Bailey by video.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Donna Harris and Tom Corona appeared for the Department of Corrections.  Case called to discuss conditions of Extended Supervision.  Defendant expects to be released in late September and wishes to reside in the State of Wisconsin.  Statements by all parties.  Court orders the Judgment of Conviction to be modified as follows:  "Defendant not to reside in Waukesha County, Racine County, Milwaukee County, Ozaukee County, Washington County, Walworth County, Dodge County, or Jefferson County" to replace the condition "Defendant can not reside in the State of Wisconsin, defendant must relocate outside of the State." on the Judgment of Conviction.  All other conditions to remain as previously set.

ADDRESS INFO for Shannon C Bailey
Current: 100 Corrections Dr, C/O Stanley Correctional Institution, Stanley, WI 54768 United States  (Effective: 06-16-2015)
Prior: 515 West Moreland Blvd, C/O Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States
Review hearing on June 29, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
Petitition to amend court ordered conditions filed by Department of Corrections.
Sentence Credit of 195 days is granted to the defendant
Filed by Attorney Sonderhouse requesting 195 days of credit.

Defendant Shannon C Bailey in court, in custody, with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by victim. Statement by the defendant. 

Court orders the following: 
- Total sentence: 3 years 6 months (Initial Confinement: 1  year 6 months, Extended Supervision: 2 years) 
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- Court costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision. 
- Conditions of Extended Supervision: Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling if determined by Agent. Submit to a mental health assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow through with any treatment/counseling/assessments recommended by Agent. Maintain full-time employment and/or school. No contact with victim or any member of victim's family in any way. Defendant to have no access to Facebook, any health caring accounts website, or any site of that nature. Defendant can not reside in the State of Wisconsin, defendant must relocate outside of the State. DNA Sample if not yet provided, defendant to pay surcharge.
Sentencing hearing on October 13, 2014 at 11:00 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Court orders Presentence Investigation to be completed and report filed within 30 days.  Court orders bail revoked.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Shannon C Bailey in court, in custody.  Kevin M Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant still wishes to proceed on his own behalf without counsel. Officer Dave S. from the City of Waukesha was sworn and testified on behalf of the State.  Cross examination by the defendant. Officer Brandon P. from the City of Waukesha was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. State presents exhibit #1 marked and received. Cross examination by the defendant. State rests. Shannon Bailey was sworn and testified on his own behalf. Cross examination by the State. Defendant rests. State moves for bind over and presents arguments. Defendant presents statements. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for the trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.

Defendant to be seen by the Wisconsin Forsenic Unit on a in-patient basis at the Waukesha County Jail.  Report to be completed within 15 days.    Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing. Bail remains as fixed.  Review hearing scheduled for May 2, 2014 at 08:15 am.
